business.headline: Dalal Street bleeds: Sensex tanks 824 points, Nifty below 23,000The S&P BSE Sensex was down 824.29 points to close at 75,366.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 263.05 points to end at 22,829.15.

Amul cuts milk prices by Re 1 per litre across IndiaThe reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre.

India-US relationship beyond personalities: Fareed Zakaria on Trump 2.0Fareed Zakaria shared his insights on the political shift in the United States and the seismic changes it is expected to bring geopolitically and economically across the world.

entertainment.headline: X users turn on Diljit Dosanjh after Coldplay's Ahmedabad triumph: Stop complainingAfter Coldplay's massive final concert in Ahmedabad, singer Diljit Dosanjh came under fire from X users for his remarks that he would not perform in India again due to inadequate infrastructure.

Coldplay makes history with Ahmedabad concert, but it's not a world recordColdplay on Sunday created history by delivering its biggest-ever concert in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. However, the band couldn't surpass the world record of having the largest number of attendees at a concert.

Dhoom Dhaam trailer: Pratik Gandhi and Yami Gautam promise a fun Valentine's filmThe first trailer of the upcoming Netflix release, Dhoom Dhaam, is here. The film promises an exciting blend of romance and adventure.

Chris Martin pauses My Universe to ensure fan safety at Ahmedabad showDuring Sunday's concert in Ahmedabad, Coldplay's lead singer Chris Martin paused mid-performance to ensure the safety of a fan. The moment was captured during the show's live-streaming on Disney+ Hotstar.

Chris Martin jokes he is from Telangana, calls Coldplay an Indian bandDuring their recent performance in India, Coldplay's lead singer, Chris Martin, joked about being born here. The British rock band concluded their India tour with a final concert in Ahmedabad on Sunday.

Stranger Things 5 out in November? Eagle-eyed fans spot release dateStranger Things fans may have discovered the release date for the fifth season through a Netflix code. The show will reportedly be released in November 2025.

Storyteller trailer: Paresh Rawal, Adil Hussain shine in Satyajit Ray's short storyThe trailer for The Storyteller starring Paresh Rawal and Adil Hussain has been released. The film brings emotional complexity to Satyajit Ray's classic short story Golpo Boliye Tarini Khuro.

general news.headline: Parliament Waqf panel accepts NDA MPs' amendments, rejects Opposition's changesWaqf Bill: BJP MP Jagdambika Pal, who led the Parliamentary panel, said the amendments moved by the NDA members in 14 of the Bill's clauses have been accepted.

Bumrah becomes 6th Indian to win ICC Test Cricketer of the YearIndian pacer Jasprit Bumrah has been crowned the ICC Men's Test Cricketer of the Year 2024. Jasprit Bumrah picked up 71 wickets from 13 Test matches in 2024, topping the charts. He was clear of second-placed Gus Atkinson, who took 52 wickets from 11 Tests.

RG Kar rape-murder victim's parents not seeking death for convict, court toldRG Kar rape-murder victim's parents oppose the death penalty for Sanjoy Roy, the convict. Their lawyer informed the Calcutta High Court, which has reserved its judgement on appeals from the West Bengal government and CBI seeking a death sentence.

Indians in US: From model immigrants to targets of MAGA tiradeIndians, one of the finest examples of model immigrants in the US, have become the latest punching bags for the Make America Great Again (MAGA) army on social media. From the H-1B issue of "they are taking our jobs" to claims of "casteist attitudes", Indians are facing online attacks, and fear real-life harassment.

Why Himanta chose Dibrugarh as Assam's second capital. ExplainedAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, considered the Chanakya of Northeast politics, announced that Dibrugarh would be the second capital of Assam. There are at least five key reasons behind the politically and culturally significant move, which will see power flow up the Brahmaputra.

One Nation One Election report cost Centre Rs 95,000 - Rs 491 per dayThe government spent Rs 95,344 on drafting the 'One Nation, One Election' report, prepared by a high-level panel led by former President Ram Nath Kovind. The report, finalised after 194 days, examined the feasibility of simultaneous elections.

What is DeepSeek R1 AI and why is everyone talking about it: Story in 5 pointsIf you are keeping an eye on AI stuff, you must have come across DeepSeek. This is a new AI model, but unlike the ones that we have seen so far, this one comes from China, and it has set the world of AI abuzz. But what is DeepSeek, and why is everyone talking about it? We explain.

Uzbek player explains handshake snub with Vaishali, apologises in lengthy postGrandmaster Yakubboev Nordirbek said he refused to shake hands with R Vaishali earlier in January at a Tata Steel Chess tournament due to religious reasons. The 23-year-old created a stir with his gesture as video clip went viral.

Over 1,000 Olive Ridley turtles found dead along Chennai coast in one month  Over 1,000 carcasses of Olive Ridley turtles, a protected species, washed ashore along Chennai's coast in a month. Environmental activists blamed the deaths on illegal fishing practices in the region.

6.5 million children at risk, says expert Atul Gawande as Trump freezes fundsAmerican surgeon and public health expert Dr Atul Gawande has criticised the Trump administration's stop-work order of 90 days, which put a pause on all existing foreign aid and stopped any new funds. Gawande has criticised the move and said it could lead to grave consequences, impacting nearly 6.5 million children across the world.

UCC in Uttarakhand from today: Impact on marriage, divorce, succession, 'halala'Uttarakhand became the first state in India to implement the Uniform Civil Code, effective today. Here's how the UCC will impact marriage, divorce, and succession once it is enforced.

Amit Shah takes dip in Maha Kumbh with Ramdev, Yogi Adityanath; Jay Shah presentAmit Shah arrived in Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh Mela, and took a dip at Sangam Ghat and received blessings from the saints. He called the Kumbh a symbol of Sanatan culture and unity.

The high cost of living with breast cancer in IndiaBreast cancer cases and its economic impact are projected to grow substantially in India, with an annual increase of 5.6%. The economic burden of breast cancer willincrease to $13.96 billion by 2030.

Despite greatness, Djokovic's love-hate affair with tennis world continuesAhead of the Australian Open final, Novak Djokovic shared his MRI results to shut down any doubts about his injury, showing he's still fighting for respect in a tough field. Despite all his success, his tricky relationship with fans and the media, shaped by past controversies and his fiery attitude, still plays a big role in how he's seen.

Riyan Parag to return from injury and captain Assam in Ranji Trophy: ReportsRiyan Parag's return from injury to lead Assam in their final Ranji Trophy league fixture against Saurashtra offers the young all-rounder a chance to rebuild form and fitness while boosting Assam's campaign in domestic cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
